metadata.Title: CVE-2019-16410 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Suricata 4.1.4. By sending multiple fragmented IPv4 packets, the function Defrag4Reassemble in defrag.c tries to access a memory region that is not allocated, because of a lack of header_len checking.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16410` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

suricata - 1:4.1.5-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: suricata package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:4.1.5-1').
